questionTitle: Do any CSP controlled accounts have cloud-wide privileges?
metrices: Yes. The root/admin account has cloud-wide privileges. Also state the operations that are allowed like read write operations etc.

questionTitle: How does the CSP manage user authentication?
metrices: Name, password, token, ID, biometric ( finger print, voice)

questionTitle: Does the CSP use multifactor access controls? Which one.
metrices: Yes / No. Google auth, OTP, Email etc.

questionTitle: Does the CSP enforce privilege separation (for instance, RBAC)?
metrices: Yes / No. User or role based or group base with least privilege principle or other means.

questionTitle: Does the CSP grant tenants or users administrator privileges? If so, what is the level of access?
metrices: Yes / No. Level of access defined for tenant’s users.

questionTitle: Does the CSP verify user identity at registration, and if so, are there different levels of checks depending on resources to which access is granted?
metrices: Yes / No. Number of resource access and level of use as access profile for every user

questionTitle: How are the credentials and accounts de-provisioned?
metrices: Subjective description of the process for de-provisioning users accounts.

questionTitle: Is the CSP’s system interoperable with third party identity provider systems?
metrices: No of third party identity provider.

questionTitle: Can a customer incorporate single sign on?
No of fail attempt to lock user account?
metrices: Total failed login attempts for a specific user.

questionTitle: Can a customer interact with the CSP via an API?
metrices: Yes / No. Level of access granted via API

questionTitle: Can a customer use a cloud management interface?
metrices: Yes / No. When remote Management is allowed by CSP.

questionTitle: Do any CSP controlled accounts have cloud-wide privileges?
metrices: Yes. The root/admin account has cloud-wide privileges. Also state the operations that are allowed like read write operations etc.
